chapter: 1 Git and GitHub for Public Health
heading: 1 Git and GitHub for Public Health
text:
website training “Git GitHub Public Health”,
first offered 2024.

chapter: 1 Git and GitHub for Public Health
heading: 1.1 Overview
text:
Keeping track changes statistical code key reducing errors boosting teamwork projects. However, many public health professionals, including epidemiologists, haven’t trained manage changes, might leave wondering integration institutional review board (IRB) protocols privacy rules. website, dive basics Git GitHub. ’re show tools can help confidently ethically manage code changes, making work research smoother secure.Questions? Comments?Contact us c.riddell@berkeley.edu wilnerl@uw.edu questions,
comments, feedback!

text:
pre-workshop guide designed walk initial setup Git
computer.issues, please reach us c.riddell@berkeley.edu 
wilnerl@uw.edu.

text:
Installing Git different depending whether using Windows Mac.
Follow relevant instructions.

heading: 2.5.1 Windows Instructions
text:
Download Git Windows: https://git-scm.com/download/win. download
begins, many menu items click . recommended 
fantastic website HappyGitWithR, accept
default selections except item “Adjusting PATH environment”.
, make sure select “Git command line also 3rd-party
software”. HappyGitWithR also notes
“RStudio Windows prefers Git 
installed C:/Program Files appears default. 
implies, example, Git executable Windows system found 
C:/Program Files/Git/bin/git.exe. Unless specific reasons otherwise,
follow convention.following video shows download install Git Windows. View 
full screen high quality want follow along:Git downloads, confirm access Git Bash. ,
appear Start menu: Start menu > Git > Git Bash.Git downloads, confirm access Git Bash. ,
appear Start menu: Start menu > Git > Git Bash.RStudio automatically detect presence Git Bash. can inspect
influence directly via Tools > Global Options > Terminal. Unless 
good reason otherwise, want see “Git Bash” “New
terminals open …” dropdown menu.RStudio automatically detect presence Git Bash. can inspect
influence directly via Tools > Global Options > Terminal. Unless 
good reason otherwise, want see “Git Bash” “New
terminals open …” dropdown menu.next set tasks done RStudio outlined section
“Configure Git using HTTPS token” Mac instructions.next set tasks done RStudio outlined section

text:
Open Terminal application, type git --version check Git 
already installed. , see version number. , type:
git config press return. prompted install Git 
follow prompts!

heading: 2.6 Configure Git using an HTTPS token
text:
RStudio, load libraries usethis & gitcreds:Use function use_git_config() configure Git using HTTPS token. 
, type following RStudio Console (lower left panel), filling 
user name, email. user name – doesn’t need 
GitHub user name. user.email email address linked GitHub
account.Next , need create personal access token. way 
authenticate GitHub. need order push 
pull GitHub repository. , run following R console:bring browser page. Put description token 
select expiration date drop - please select expiration.
Scroll click Generate token button. Copy token 
generated paste somewhere able access .Go back R/RStudio run following:prompted, paste GitHub token copied website. 
add credentials cache. following print RStudio
console:
code:
library(usethis)
library(gitcreds)
use_git_config(user.name = "Your user name",
               user.email = "your.email.adress@gmail.com")
usethis::create_github_token()  
gitcreds::gitcreds_set()? Enter password or token: ghp_xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx  
-> Adding new credentials...
-> Removing credentials from cache...
-> Done.

heading: 3.1 What is version control, Git, and Github?
text:
Version control practice tracking managing changes 
(statistical) code files.Git version control system. tracks changed file,
synchronizes changes central server multiple
contributors can manage changes set files (Wilson et al., 2017).GitHub hosting service web Git repositories.

heading: 3.2 The case for version control
text:
Reduces ErrorsVersion control eliminates need send code outputs (graphics,
reports) via email share folders collaborators. version
control system, everyone access recent set files.Facilitates reproducible analysesHave ever tried reproduce analysis 3 years ago? ever
tried reproduce someone else’s analysis? ever found links
don’t work computer? access data?everyone access files, project’s workflow can set 
ensures analyses reproducible everyone.R, can simple hitting “knit” button run analyses
anyone’s computer – need update file pathways, need download
new versions code data.Eases supports supervision collaborationWith Github, can easily view changes made statistical code. 
working together, easy tell lines code changed,
alongside downstream changes reports data visualizations result 
change analysis.Facilitates rollbacksYou can use Git roll back previous version file point. 
useful team decides change made code beneficial
wants revert back different strategy used previously.Supports expeditious sharing scientific approaches findingsAnything posted GitHub can shared widely organization 
public.

going training asynchronously, can flip Alice’s slides

heading: 5 Interacting with Terminal and Bash
text:
two things cover dive Git Github. First,
using Mac’s Terminal Window’s Bash training. 
never used applications , introduce , 
become familiar . Second, discuss good names files folders,
good names make good times interact Terminal Bash.

heading: 5.1 A Terminal window
text:
use Terminal Bash applications interact Git laptops.
Mac Terminal window. looks similar Windows Bash window.training, supply Git code type 
Terminal/Bash windows.input command hit Enter/return 
keyboard, Terminal/Bash display output screen. Pay attention
output indicate command understood 
computer something went wrong. example, command
git branch, followed output printed screen:

heading: 6 Naming folders and files
text:
working Terminal/Bash, important use good folder 
file names make life easier. Recall name variable SAS 
R, variable name contain spaces unusual characters. best
practice use spaces unusual characters folder file names, even
though spaces permissible commonly used Windows Mac Users.may wonder problem spaces, anyway? 
spaces human-readable aren’t machine-friendly. refer 
folder file using Git Terminal Bash, name without spaces much
easier type (otherwise insert backslash space).
Spaces also break auto-complete function Git users love. 
frustrating.Good folder names files names use dashes underscores place spaces.
example “life-expectancy” great folder name project estimating
life expectancy, “pollution-ptb” great folder name project
estimating causal effect air pollution preterm birth.Good names code filesWhen running statistical analysis, underlying order across 
code files (e.g., starting importing data, data cleaning, 
analysis). Good code file names start number (padded 0)
order files according order performed analysis. 
followed short (human machine readable) descriptor file
. can also use underscore “_” delimit field, dashes “-” 
separate words within field.example, file names “pollution-ptb” folder:files :machine readablehuman readableplay well default orderingFlip Jenny Bryan’s slide set deeper dive file naming:happens bad names?issue frustration includes spaces file names really hits home 
include spaces names trying interacting GitHub add files
make commit – like pain frustration – can try home!example, suppose made R markdown file called “Data Visualization
Evaluation Report.rmd”. screenshot , can see file 
modified used git status command. issue occurs need
add file using git add {file_name}. typed git add Data Visualization Evaluation Report.rmd
error Git doesn’t know name continues 
space word “Data”! Even worse, space breaks auto-complete
functionality occurs press “tab” auto-complete file name
typing first letters.really add file need use escape character (backlash “\”)
space name, shown git add command highlighted 
yellow.might now sound like big deal
haven’t interacted Terminal/Bash much, can guarantee 
frustration build crescendo time… save 
pain using dashes underscores instead spaces!

heading: 7.1 Outline for this section
text: discussed Git GitHub important, now set repository work example. first section, working repository alone. :Make new repository GitHubClone repository local machineWrite code repository locallyPush code repositoryMerge branch main

heading: 7.2 Set up a project that you want to track with git and GitHub
text:
Let’s suppose project want start tracking using Git Github. project, already working code, data, visualizations already saved. made project . download , run following two commands RStudio console:R asked want folder copied onto Desktop. Select Yes.R display messages showing folder downloaded unzipped.
Tell R whether delete file.RStudio open. Click code folder file viewer. , click
filename “01_Analyze-life-expectancy.R” open file RStudio.Run code .R file just downloaded. Note created figure 
saved images sub-folder. Alternatively, open SAS file
“01_Analyze-life-expectancy.sas” run equivalent SAS code.Now set existing code things might want start
tracking GitHub. next thing make folder GitHub 
store project.
code:
install.packages("usethis")
usethis::use_course("corinne-riddell/existing-project")

heading: 7.3 Make a new repository on GitHub
text:
Go github.com log . Click green “New” button make GitHub
repository. Type “life-expectancy” repository name.Write whatever want description. example, type “analysis life expectancy US”Select either make public private repository.Check box next Add README file. tells Git create file can describe project. now, can write sentence practice repository workshop.Choose .gitignore template: R. tells Git use defaults work well R users.Choose MIT License. relates licensing code, relevant workshop.Click “Create repository”. Github bring repository’s
main page.

heading: 7.4 Clone the repository to your local machine
text:
main page repository click green Code button.’ll see URL starts https://. Push icon two overlapping
squares copy URL clipboard.Open Terminal (Mac) Bash (Windows) program. Navigate want place
repository using cd {folder_name} command. write
git clone {paste url copied } 
press return/enter button. following display Terminal/Bash
successful:now ready begin tracking changes folder using Git GitHub.
code:
Biostat-MBP13-20:repos corinneriddell$ git clone https://github.com/corinne-riddell/life-expectancy.git

Cloning into 'life-expectancy'...

text: get oriented, following Terminal/Bash window:Navigate repository typing cd life-expectancy/.Type git status. results shows changes made yet:Type git branch. shows currently main branch.

nothing to commit, working tree cleanBiostat-MBP13-20:life-expectancy corinneriddell$git branch

heading: 7.6 Make your first branch
text:
Set new branch main. Terminal/Bash:Type git checkout -b may3-XY, replacing XY initials. (today
May 3, replace “may3” today’s date.)Type git branch, confirm indeed switched 
new branch.
code:
Biostat-MBP13-20:life-expectancy corinneriddell$ git checkout -b may3-cr
Switched to a new branch 'may3-cr'Biostat-MBP13-20:life-expectancy corinneriddell$ git branch
  main
* may3-cr

text:
Okay, now set track changes. Let’s following:Copy code/ data/ images/ sub-folders “existing-project” folder 
“life-expectancy” folder.

heading: 7.8 Commit the changes that you made and push them to GitHub
text:
Go back Terminal Bash. Type git status. output tell 
changed. tells us untracked files:want track code/, data/ images/ subfolders just copied , well life-expectancy.Rproj file.Use git add add newly-added files tracked. use git status confirm added everything want track:Note: Computers create files don’t want track. example, Macs create
.DS_Store files. Another example Windows creates temporary files Word
doc Excel spreadsheet open. see weird files listed 
Untracked files list. don’t need worry don’t want
track changes files.Commit changes locally: git commit -m 'commit message', replace
‘commit message’ short message ’ve done (keep 
quotes around message). example, message something like
git commit -m "added first set files".Push changes GitHub: git push origin {branch-name}, replacing
{branch-name} name branch. don’t remember branch’s
name, type git branch print screen git push command.successfully pushed changes GitHub!
code:

On branch may3-cr

    images/

able merge branch main without problems. Note message “
branch conflicts base branch”. means good go!Click green “Merge pull request” button.Click green “Confirm merge” button.Click “Delete branch” button.

text:
Helpful hint: Terminal/Bash plays well autocomplete. example, 
typing pathway .R file “code/…” can push tab button
typing name autocomplete. makes selecting 
specific files commit much easier.git commit -m '{message}'
